intro: Racosperma newbeyi, commonly known as the Newbey's raceme. It is a flowering plant native to Australia, characterized by its erect, slender stem and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is known for its nitrogen-fixing abilities. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Racosperma newbeyi is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
